headline: Synopsys Says It Hasn’t Received Notice to Stop Exports to China, Pushing Back on Report
summary: Shares of semiconductor software design companies  Synopsys  and  Cadence Design Systems  were bouncing back in late trading Wednesday after Synopsys pushed back on a report that it had been told by the Trump administration to stop sales to China.  On Wednesday afternoon, the Financial Times had cited people familiar with the matter who said that the Commerce Department told electronic design automation companies like Cadence and Synopsys to stop supplying their technology to China.  “We are aware of the reporting and speculation, but Synopsys has not received a notice from BIS.”

raw.headline: Synopsys Says It Hasn’t Received Notice to Stop Exports to China, Pushing Back on Report
raw.summary: Shares of semiconductor software design companies  Synopsys  and  Cadence Design Systems  were bouncing back in late trading Wednesday after Synopsys pushed back on a report that it had been told by the Trump administration to stop sales to China.  On Wednesday afternoon, the Financial Times had cited people familiar with the matter who said that the Commerce Department told electronic design automation companies like Cadence and Synopsys to stop supplying their technology to China.  “We are aware of the reporting and speculation, but Synopsys has not received a notice from BIS.”

headline: Why Cadence (CDNS) Stock Is Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of semiconductor design software provider Cadence Design Systems (NASDAQ:CDNS) fell 5.2% in the afternoon session after the Trump administration told US companies that make software for designing semiconductor chips to stop selling to China. This instruction was aimed at restricting China's ability to develop advanced semiconductor chips, a critical area for artificial intelligence.

raw.headline: Why Cadence (CDNS) Stock Is Trading Lower Today
raw.summary: Shares of semiconductor design software provider Cadence Design Systems (NASDAQ:CDNS) fell 5.2% in the afternoon session after the Trump administration told US companies that make software for designing semiconductor chips to stop selling to China. This instruction was aimed at restricting China's ability to develop advanced semiconductor chips, a critical area for artificial intelligence.

headline: Why Cadence Design Systems Plunged Late in the Day Today
summary: A late-day news article said the Trump administration had asked major EDA firms like Cadence to stop selling to China.  China made up 12% of Cadence's revenue last year.  Shares of electronic design automation company Cadence Design Systems (NASDAQ: CDNS) dropped late Wednesday, finishing the day down 10.4%.

headline: Trump Blocks Chip Design Software Firms From Selling In China
summary: Cadence and Synopsys tumbled after the Trump administration blocked the chip design software firms from selling in China.

raw.headline: Trump Blocks Chip Design Software Firms From Selling In China
raw.summary: Cadence and Synopsys tumbled after the Trump administration blocked the chip design software firms from selling in China.

headline: Trump orders U.S. firms to halt chip software sales to China, says FT
summary: Investing.com -- In a new move to hinder China’s development of advanced semiconductor chips, the Trump administration has reportedly instructed U.S. companies that provide software used in semiconductor design to cease sales to Chinese entities, according to a report by the Financial Times on Wednesday. The directive was issued by the Bureau of Industry and Security, a division of the U.S. commerce department that supervises export controls.

raw.headline: Trump orders U.S. firms to halt chip software sales to China, says FT
raw.summary: Investing.com -- In a new move to hinder China’s development of advanced semiconductor chips, the Trump administration has reportedly instructed U.S. companies that provide software used in semiconductor design to cease sales to Chinese entities, according to a report by the Financial Times on Wednesday. The directive was issued by the Bureau of Industry and Security, a division of the U.S. commerce department that supervises export controls.

headline: US chip designers ordered by Trump to stop selling to China: FT
summary: US companies that create software to help design chips, such as Synopsys (SNPS) and Cadence Design Systems (CDNS), have been ordered by the Commerce Department to stop selling their services to China, according to a report from the Financial Times. Market Domination Anchors Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton report the details in the video above. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.
